# ccviR

The ccviR package implements the [NatureServe Climate Change
Vulnerability Index (CCVI) version
3.02](https://www.natureserve.org/conservation-tools/climate-change-vulnerability-index)
in an R package and Shiny App. The package allows all of the geospatial
aspects of calculating the CCVI to be done in R, removing the need for
separate GIS calculations. The app provides an interactive application
designed to offer a user-friendly and simple interface for calculating
the NatureServe CCVI.

The NatureServe CCVI is a rapid assessment tool designed to allow a
relative grouping of unrelated taxa by vulnerability to climate change
and to highlight which factors contribute to the climate change
vulnerability of individual species or groups of taxa. This information
can be used to inform conservation decision making and to help identify
actions to increase species resilience to climate change. See [Young et.
al
(2012)](https://www.degruyter.com/document/doi/10.7208/9780226074641-007/html),
[Young et. al.Â (2015)](https://doi.org/10.1002/wsb.478) and the
[NatureServe CCVI
Guidelines](https://www.natureserve.org/sites/default/files/guidelines_natureserveclimatechangevulnerabilityindex_r3.02_1_jun_2016.pdf)
for more detailed descriptions of the index and how it was created.

## Installation

You can install the development version of ccviR from
[GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("LandSciTech/ccviR")
```

## Launching the app

The code below will open the app in your default browser with an example
data set available.

``` r
library(ccviR)
run_ccvi_app("demo")
```

While the following will open the app with the current working directory
as the default data location.

``` r
run_ccvi_app()
```

## Comparison to the NatureServe CCVI tool

ccviR uses the same vulnerability factors and scoring algorithm as the
original NatureServe Excel spreadsheet. The index values, scores and
Monte Carlo uncertainty analysis produced are the same.

### New Features

- Spatial analyses are included in the package so only minimal GIS
  skills are needed
- Uses climate data from the whole species range rather than the range
  in the assessment area to score thermal and hydrological niche factors
- Simultaneously calculates the index for multiple scenarios such as,
  emissions scenarios, time horizons or GCMs
- A function and Shiny app to classify new climate data sets into
  exposure categories
- Plots that explain the drivers of the index value
- Allows the full assessment to be carried out in a reproducible
  environment
- Simplifies synthetic analyses across many species, groups or regions
- The Shiny app provides a Graphical User Interface to calculate the
  NatureServe CCVI
- The Shiny app allows users to calculate the index without knowing R
- Makes the NatureServe CCVI accessible to a wider audience

## Vignettes/tutorials available

See
[`vignette("app_vignette2", package = "ccviR")`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/articles/app_vignette2.md)
for an introduction to the index and how to use the app,
[`vignette("data_prep_vignette", package = "ccviR")`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/articles/data_prep_vignette.md)
for how to use an app to prepare custom climate data sets, and
[`vignette("package_vignette", package = "ccviR")`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/articles/package_vignette.md)
for a tutorial on how to use the package to calculate the index directly
in R.

# Package index

## All functions

- [`analyze_spatial()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/analyze_spatial.md)
  : Run the spatial analysis
- [`brks_to_txt()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/brks_to_txt.md)
  : Convert breaks matrix to text that can be stored in readme
- [`calc_ccei()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/calc_ccei.md)
  : Caculate CCEI from prepared rasters
- [`calc_vulnerability()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/calc_vulnerability.md)
  : Calculate the vulnerability index score
- [`ccei_values()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/ccei_values.md)
  : Calculate Annual Climate Moisture Deficit and Mean Temperature
- [`ccei_vars()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/ccei_vars.md)
  : Calculate monthly Climate Moisture Deficit and Mean Temperature
- [`check_polys()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/check_polys.md)
  : Check and fix polygons
- [`comb_index_tbl`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/comb_index_tbl.md)
  : Combined index lookup table
- [`context_North_Am`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/context_North_Am.md)
  : Contextual map data for North America
- [`get_clim_vars()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/get_clim_vars.md)
  : Load climate variables
- [`make_vuln_df()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/make_vuln_df.md)
  : Make vulnerability table
- [`plot_bivar_exp()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/plot_bivar_exp.md)
  : Plot bivariate exposure map
- [`plot_evidence()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/plot_evidence.md)
  : Plot evidence by type
- [`plot_q_score()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/plot_q_score.md)
  : Plot scores for each vulnerability question
- [`plot_score_index()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/plot_score_index.md)
  : Visualize the D score, B/C score and index
- [`prep_ccei()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/prep_ccei.md)
  : Prepare Climate Change Exposure Index raster
- [`prep_ccei_future()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/prep_ccei_future.md)
  : Prepare Future Data for Climate Change Exposure Index
- [`prep_ccei_historical()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/prep_ccei_historical.md)
  : Prepare Historical Data for Climate Change Exposure Index
- [`prep_clim_data()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/prep_clim_data.md)
  : Prepare climate data
- [`prep_clim_data_multi()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/prep_clim_data_multi.md)
  : Prepare climate data for multiple scenarios
- [`prep_clim_readme()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/prep_clim_readme.md)
  : Prepare README for climate data
- [`rng_chg_mat()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/rng_chg_mat.md)
  : Create a range change matrix
- [`run_ccvi_app()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/run_ccvi_app.md)
  : Launch the CCVI app
- [`run_data_prep()`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/run_data_prep.md)
  : Launch the data preparation app
- [`spatial_file_poly`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/spatial_file_poly.md)
  : Lists of spatial file types for polygons
- [`spatial_file_raster`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/spatial_file_raster.md)
  : Lists of spatial file types for rasters
- [`spatial_file_types`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/spatial_file_types.md)
  : Lists of spatial file types for all spatial files
- [`ui_build_table`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/ui_build_table.md)
  : Table to build the UI
- [`vulnq_code_lu_tbl`](https://landscitech.github.io/ccviR/reference/vulnq_code_lu_tbl.md)
  : Lookup table for vulnerability factor codes
